text.title: Start the One Punch Man Workout
text.head: Start the One Punch Man Workout
text.p: In the hit anime "One Punch Man" the protagonist, Saitaman, claims to have achieved his super human strength by following a strict daily training routine of: 100 push-ups, 100 sit-ups, 100 squats, and running a 10k (6.2 miles). Though this may sound difficult, it is very achievable. Follow these steps and you will be able to keep up with his daily routine!
text.head: Steps
calculate where your skills, collecting and analyzing.

list.item:
Preform and record each the following workouts once a day for the next 5 days (the data collected will give you a baseline to start at)
Do as many push-ups as you can and record the amount each day
Do as many sit-ups as you can and record the amount each day
Do as many squats as you can and record the amount each day
Run as far as you can and record how far in kilometers each day

Upon completion of your first 5 days take the averages of each of the individual workout (the average of each workout will be your starting point)
add up the total amount of push-ups from each day then divide by 5
add up the total amount of sit-ups from each day then divide by 5
add up the total amount of squats from each day then divide by 5
add up the total amount of kilometers ran from each day then divide by 5

text.head: calculate your averages

list.item:
Find your calisthenics (push-ups, sit-ups, squats) group in the matrix below. Take your average from each of the workouts and see what Group you fall into. The group may be different for each workout.
(1-10 reps) Group 1 group min= 1 rep group max= 10 reps
(11-20 reps) Group 2 group min= 11 reps group max= 20 reps
(21-30 reps) Group 3 group min= 21 reps group max= 30 reps
(31-40 reps) Group 4 group min= 31 reps group max= 40 reps
(41-50 reps) Group 5 group min= 41 reps group max= 50 reps
(51-60 reps) Group 6 group min= 51 reps group max= 60 reps
(61-70 reps) Group 7 group min= 61 reps group max= 70 reps
(71-80 reps) Group 8 group min= 71 reps group max= 80 reps
(81-90 reps) Group 9 group min= 81 reps group max= 90 reps
(>91 reps) Group 10 group min= 91 reps group max= 100 reps

Find your cardio (running) group in the matrix below. Take your average distance from your 5 runs and see what Group you fall into.
(0-1 km) Group 1 group min= .2 km group max= 1 km
(1-2 km) Group 2 group min= 1 km group max= 2 km
(2-3 km) Group 3 group min= 2 km group max= 3 km
(3-4 km) Group 4 group min= 3 km group max= 4 km
(4-5 km) Group 5 group min= 4 km group max= 5 km
(5-6 km) Group 6 group min= 5 km group max= 6 km
(6-7 km) Group 7 group min= 6 km group max= 7 km
(7-8 km) Group 8 group min= 7 km group max= 8 km
(8-9 km) Group 9 group min= 8 km group max= 9 km
(9-10 km) Group 10 group min= 8 km group max= 10 km

text.head: Your Training Routine

list.item:
Perform the following workouts each week. The first week will be a difficult week as you will be acclimatizing your body to continuous workouts. Record what you do each day to monitor progress.
(Day 1) Run your group min distance. Perform 2 sets of the maximum amount you can do for each of the calisthenics (your max).
(Day 2) Run as far as you can (your max) distance, then walk the remaining distance to your group max distance. Perform 5 sets of each workout to your group min.
(Day 3) Walk your group max distance.
(Day 4) Run your max distance. Perform 4 sets of your group min and 1 set of your max for each workout.
(Day 5) Walk your group max distance.
(Day 6) Run your group's min distance then walk the remainder to group max. Perform 3 sets of your group min workouts.
(Day 7) Run your max distance. Perform 1 set of your max for each workout

Assess yourself after 7 days.
Perform/Run your max for the workout(s) you would like to advance in prior to your daily workout for the next 7 days
Take the average of those workouts and if it is above the next group min move up a group
Continue all workouts as you move up through the groups. Once you reach the max group of a certain workout replace the daily workout of that type with 100 reps or if it's running a 10k.
Continue workouts and runs until all workouts are at 100 reps/day and all runs are at 10km/day

text.head: The One Punch Routine
Tips

list.item: Don't be discouraged if you miss a day or 10: pick up where you left off and if your group min is too hard, drop down a group.

text.head: Warnings

list.item: Don't hurt yourself, workout at your own risk.
